availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Ohio Congressman and U.S. Army general. Native of Franklin, Ohio. Son of William Cortenus Schenck. Graduated from Miami University in Oxford, Ohio, with a Bachelor of Arts in 1827 and a Master of Arts in 1830. Professor at Miami University from 1827 to 1829. Admitted to the Ohio bar in January 1831. Member of Ohio House of Representatives from 1841 to 1842. U.S. Congressman from 1843 to 1851. U.S. envoy and minister to Brazil from March 12, 1851, to October 8, 1853. Served in U.S. Volunteers as a brigadier general from May 17, 1861, to August 30, 1862, and as major general from August 30, 1862, to December 5, 1863. U.S. Congressman from March 4, 1863, to January 5, 1871.
